segment.source: This topic describes performance guidelines for apps that require access to a user's location.
segment.target: This topic describes performance guidelines for apps that require access to a user's location.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Start using the location object only when the app requires location data.
segment.target: Start using the location object only when the app requires location data.

segment.source: Call the RequestAccessAsync before accessing the user’s location.
segment.target: Call the RequestAccessAsync before accessing the user’s location.

segment.source: At that time, your app must be in the foreground and RequestAccessAsync must be called from the UI thread.
segment.target: At that time, your app must be in the foreground and RequestAccessAsync must be called from the UI thread.

segment.source: Until the user grants your app permission to their location, your app can't access location data.
segment.target: Until the user grants your app permission to their location, your app can't access location data.

segment.source: If location isn't essential to your app, don't access it until the user tries to complete a task that requires it.
segment.target: If location isn't essential to your app, don't access it until the user tries to complete a task that requires it.

segment.source: For example, if a social networking app has a button for "Check in with my location," the app shouldn't access location until the user clicks the button.
segment.target: For example, if a social networking app has a button for "Check in with my location," the app shouldn't access location until the user clicks the button.

segment.source: It's okay to immediately access location if it is required for your app's main function.
segment.target: It's okay to immediately access location if it is required for your app's main function.

segment.source: The first use of the Geolocator object must be made on the main UI thread of the foreground app, to trigger the consent prompt to the user.
segment.target: The first use of the Geolocator object must be made on the main UI thread of the foreground app, to trigger the consent prompt to the user.

segment.source: The first use of the Geolocator can be either the first call to getGeopositionAsync or the first registration of a handler for the positionChanged event.
segment.target: The first use of the Geolocator can be either the first call to getGeopositionAsync or the first registration of a handler for the positionChanged event.

segment.source: Tell the user how location data will be used.
segment.target: Tell the user how location data will be used.

segment.source: Provide UI to enable users to manually refresh their location.
segment.target: Provide UI to enable users to manually refresh their location.

segment.source: Display a progress bar or ring while waiting to get location data.
segment.target: Display a progress bar or ring while waiting to get location data.

segment.source: Show appropriate error messages or dialogs when location services are disabled or not available.
segment.target: Show appropriate error messages or dialogs when location services are disabled or not available.

segment.source: If the location settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend providing a convenient link to the location privacy settings in the Settings app.
segment.target: If the location settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend providing a convenient link to the location privacy settings in the Settings app.

segment.source: For example, you could use a Hyperlink control or call the LaunchUriAsync method to launch the Settings app from code using the URI.
segment.target: For example, you could use a Hyperlink control or call the LaunchUriAsync method to launch the Settings app from code using the URI.

segment.source: For more info, see Launch the Windows Settings app.
segment.target: For more info, see Launch the Windows Settings app.

segment.source: Clear cached location data and release the Geolocator when the user disables access to location info.
segment.target: Clear cached location data and release the Geolocator when the user disables access to location info.

segment.source: Release the Geolocator object if the user turns off access to location info through Settings.
segment.target: Release the Geolocator object if the user turns off access to location info through Settings.

segment.source: The app will then receive ACCESS\_DENIED results for any location API calls.
segment.target: The app will then receive ACCESS\_DENIED results for any location API calls.

segment.source: If your app saves or caches location data, clear any cached data when the user revokes access to location info.
segment.target: If your app saves or caches location data, clear any cached data when the user revokes access to location info.

segment.source: Provide an alternate way to manually enter location info when location data is not available via location services.
segment.target: Provide an alternate way to manually enter location info when location data is not available via location services.

segment.source: Provide UI for reenabling location services.
segment.target: Provide UI for reenabling location services.

segment.source: For example, provie a refresh button that reinstantiates the Geolocator object and tries to get location info again.
segment.target: For example, provie a refresh button that reinstantiates the Geolocator object and tries to get location info again.

segment.source: Have your app provide UI for reenabling location services—
segment.target: Have your app provide UI for reenabling location services—

segment.source: If the user reenables location access after disabling it, there is no notification to the app.
segment.target: If the user reenables location access after disabling it, there is no notification to the app.

segment.source: The status property does not change and there is no statusChanged event.
segment.target: The status property does not change and there is no statusChanged event.

segment.source: Your app should create a new Geolocator object and call getGeopositionAsync to try to get updated location data, or subscribe again to positionChanged events.
segment.target: Your app should create a new Geolocator object and call getGeopositionAsync to try to get updated location data, or subscribe again to positionChanged events.

segment.source: If the status then indicates that location has been reenabled, clear any UI by which your app previously notified the user that location services were disabled, and respond appropriately to the new status.
segment.target: If the status then indicates that location has been reenabled, clear any UI by which your app previously notified the user that location services were disabled, and respond appropriately to the new status.

segment.source: Your app should also try again to get location data upon activation, or when the user explicitly tries to use functionality that requires location info, or at any other scenario-appropriate time.
segment.target: Your app should also try again to get location data upon activation, or when the user explicitly tries to use functionality that requires location info, or at any other scenario-appropriate time.

segment.source: Performance
segment.target: Performance

segment.source: Use one-time location requests if your app doesn't need to receive location updates.
segment.target: Use one-time location requests if your app doesn't need to receive location updates.

segment.source: For example, an app that adds a location tag to a photo doesn't need to receive location update events.
segment.target: For example, an app that adds a location tag to a photo doesn't need to receive location update events.

segment.source: Instead, it should request location using getGeopositionAsync, as described in Get current location.
segment.target: Instead, it should request location using getGeopositionAsync, as described in Get current location.

segment.source: When you make a one-time location request, you should set the following values.
segment.target: When you make a one-time location request, you should set the following values.

segment.source: Specify the accuracy requested by your app by setting the DesiredAccuracy or the DesiredAccuracyInMeters.
segment.target: Specify the accuracy requested by your app by setting the DesiredAccuracy or the DesiredAccuracyInMeters.

segment.source: See below for recommendations on using these parameters
segment.target: See below for recommendations on using these parameters

segment.source: Set the max age parameter of GetGeopositionAsync to specify how long ago a location can have been obtained to be useful for your app.
segment.target: Set the max age parameter of GetGeopositionAsync to specify how long ago a location can have been obtained to be useful for your app.

segment.source: If your app can use a position that is a few seconds or minutes old, your app can receive a position almost immediately and contribute to saving device power.
segment.target: If your app can use a position that is a few seconds or minutes old, your app can receive a position almost immediately and contribute to saving device power.

segment.source: Set the timeout parameter of GetGeopositionAsync.
segment.target: Set the timeout parameter of GetGeopositionAsync.

segment.source: This is how long your app can wait for a position or an error to be returned.
segment.target: This is how long your app can wait for a position or an error to be returned.

segment.source: You will need to figure out the trade-offs between responsiveness to the user and accuracy your app needs.
segment.target: You will need to figure out the trade-offs between responsiveness to the user and accuracy your app needs.

segment.source: Use continuous location session when frequent position updates are required.
segment.target: Use continuous location session when frequent position updates are required.

segment.source: Use positionChanged and statusChanged events for detecting movement past a specific threshold or for continuous location updates as they occur.
segment.target: Use positionChanged and statusChanged events for detecting movement past a specific threshold or for continuous location updates as they occur.

segment.source: When requesting location updates, you may want to specify the accuracy requested by your app by setting the DesiredAccuracy or the DesiredAccuracyInMeters.
segment.target: When requesting location updates, you may want to specify the accuracy requested by your app by setting the DesiredAccuracy or the DesiredAccuracyInMeters.

segment.source: You should also set the frequency at which the location updates are needed, by using the MovementThreshold or the ReportInterval.
segment.target: You should also set the frequency at which the location updates are needed, by using the MovementThreshold or the ReportInterval.

segment.source: Specify the movement threshold.
segment.target: Specify the movement threshold.

segment.source: Some apps need location updates only when the user has moved a large distance.
segment.target: Some apps need location updates only when the user has moved a large distance.

segment.source: For example, an app that provides local news or weather updates may not need location updates unless the user's location has changed to a different city.
segment.target: For example, an app that provides local news or weather updates may not need location updates unless the user's location has changed to a different city.

segment.source: In this case, you adjust the minimum required movement for a location update event by setting the MovementThreshold property.
segment.target: In this case, you adjust the minimum required movement for a location update event by setting the MovementThreshold property.

segment.source: This has the effect of filtering out PositionChanged events.
segment.target: This has the effect of filtering out PositionChanged events.

segment.source: These events are raised only when the change in position exceeds the movement threshold.
segment.target: These events are raised only when the change in position exceeds the movement threshold.

segment.source: Use reportInterval that aligns with your app experience and that minimizes the use of system resources.
segment.target: Use reportInterval that aligns with your app experience and that minimizes the use of system resources.

segment.source: For example, a weather app may require a data update only every 15 minutes.
segment.target: For example, a weather app may require a data update only every 15 minutes.

segment.source: Most apps, other than real-time navigation apps, don't require a highly accurate, constant stream of location updates.
segment.target: Most apps, other than real-time navigation apps, don't require a highly accurate, constant stream of location updates.

segment.source: If your app doesn't require the most accurate stream of data possible, or requires updates infrequently, set the ReportInterval property to indicate the minimum frequency of location updates that your app needs.
segment.target: If your app doesn't require the most accurate stream of data possible, or requires updates infrequently, set the ReportInterval property to indicate the minimum frequency of location updates that your app needs.

segment.source: The location source can then conserve power by calculating location only when needed.
segment.target: The location source can then conserve power by calculating location only when needed.

segment.source: Apps that do require real-time data should set ReportInterval to 0, to indicate that no minimum interval is specified.
segment.target: Apps that do require real-time data should set ReportInterval to 0, to indicate that no minimum interval is specified.

segment.source: The default report interval is 1 second or as frequent as the hardware can support – whichever is shorter.
segment.target: The default report interval is 1 second or as frequent as the hardware can support – whichever is shorter.

segment.source: Devices that provide location data may track the report interval requested by different apps, and provide data reports at the smallest requested interval.
segment.target: Devices that provide location data may track the report interval requested by different apps, and provide data reports at the smallest requested interval.

segment.source: The app with the greatest need for accuracy thus receives the data it needs.
segment.target: The app with the greatest need for accuracy thus receives the data it needs.

segment.source: Therefore, it's possible that the location provider will generate updates at a higher frequency than your app requested, if another app has requested more frequent updates.
segment.target: Therefore, it's possible that the location provider will generate updates at a higher frequency than your app requested, if another app has requested more frequent updates.

segment.source: Note It isn't guaranteed that the location source will honor the request for the given report interval.
segment.target: Note It isn't guaranteed that the location source will honor the request for the given report interval.

segment.source: Not all location provider devices track the report interval, but you should still provide it for those that do.
segment.target: Not all location provider devices track the report interval, but you should still provide it for those that do.

segment.source: To help conserve power, set the desiredAccuracy property to indicate to the location platform whether your app needs high-accuracy data.
segment.target: To help conserve power, set the desiredAccuracy property to indicate to the location platform whether your app needs high-accuracy data.

segment.source: If no apps require high-accuracy data, the system can save power by not turning on GPS providers.
segment.target: If no apps require high-accuracy data, the system can save power by not turning on GPS providers.

segment.source: Set desiredAccuracy to HIGH to enable the GPS to acquire data.
segment.target: Set desiredAccuracy to HIGH to enable the GPS to acquire data.

segment.source: Set desiredAccuracy to Default and use only a single-shot call pattern to minimize power consumption if your app uses location info solely for ad targeting.
segment.target: Set desiredAccuracy to Default and use only a single-shot call pattern to minimize power consumption if your app uses location info solely for ad targeting.

segment.source: If your app has specific needs around accuracy, you may want to use the DesiredAccuracyInMeters property instead of using DesiredAccuracy.
segment.target: If your app has specific needs around accuracy, you may want to use the DesiredAccuracyInMeters property instead of using DesiredAccuracy.

segment.source: This is particularly useful on Windows Phone, where position can usually be obtained based on cellular beacons, Wi-Fi beacons and satellites.
segment.target: This is particularly useful on Windows Phone, where position can usually be obtained based on cellular beacons, Wi-Fi beacons and satellites.

segment.source: Picking a more specific accuracy value will help the system identify the right technologies to use with the lowest power cost when providing a position.
segment.target: Picking a more specific accuracy value will help the system identify the right technologies to use with the lowest power cost when providing a position.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: If your app is obtaining location for ads tuning, weather, news, etc, an accuracy of 5000 meter is generally enough.
segment.target: If your app is obtaining location for ads tuning, weather, news, etc, an accuracy of 5000 meter is generally enough.

segment.source: If you app is displaying nearby deals in the neighborhood, an accuracy of 300 meter is generally good to provide results.
segment.target: If you app is displaying nearby deals in the neighborhood, an accuracy of 300 meter is generally good to provide results.

segment.source: If the user is looking for recommendations to nearby restaurants, we likely want to get a position within a block, so an accuracy of 100 meters is sufficient.
segment.target: If the user is looking for recommendations to nearby restaurants, we likely want to get a position within a block, so an accuracy of 100 meters is sufficient.

segment.source: If the user is trying to share his position, the app should request an accuracy of about 10 meters.
segment.target: If the user is trying to share his position, the app should request an accuracy of about 10 meters.

segment.source: Use the Geocoordinate.accuracy property if your app has specific accuracy requirements.
segment.target: Use the Geocoordinate.accuracy property if your app has specific accuracy requirements.

segment.source: For example, navigation apps should use the Geocoordinate.accuracy property to determine whether the available location data meets the app's requirements.
segment.target: For example, navigation apps should use the Geocoordinate.accuracy property to determine whether the available location data meets the app's requirements.

segment.source: Consider start-up delay.
segment.target: Consider start-up delay.

segment.source: The first time an app requests location data, there might be a short delay (1-2 seconds) while the location provider starts up.
segment.target: The first time an app requests location data, there might be a short delay (1-2 seconds) while the location provider starts up.

segment.source: Consider this in the design of your app's UI.
segment.target: Consider this in the design of your app's UI.

segment.source: For instance, you may want to avoid blocking other tasks pending the completion of the call to GetGeopositionAsync.
segment.target: For instance, you may want to avoid blocking other tasks pending the completion of the call to GetGeopositionAsync.

segment.source: Consider background behavior.
segment.target: Consider background behavior.

segment.source: If your app doesn't have focus, it won't receive location update events while it's suspended in the background.
segment.target: If your app doesn't have focus, it won't receive location update events while it's suspended in the background.

segment.source: If your app tracks location updates by logging them, be aware of this.
segment.target: If your app tracks location updates by logging them, be aware of this.

segment.source: When the app regains focus, it receives only new events.
segment.target: When the app regains focus, it receives only new events.

segment.source: It does not get any updates that occurred when it was inactive.
segment.target: It does not get any updates that occurred when it was inactive.

segment.source: Use raw and fusion sensors efficiently.
segment.target: Use raw and fusion sensors efficiently.

segment.source: There are two types of sensors: raw and fusion.
segment.target: There are two types of sensors: raw and fusion.

segment.source: Raw sensors include the accelerometer, gyrometer, and magnetometer.
segment.target: Raw sensors include the accelerometer, gyrometer, and magnetometer.

segment.source: Fusion sensors include orientation, inclinometer, and compass.
segment.target: Fusion sensors include orientation, inclinometer, and compass.

segment.source: Fusion sensors get their data from combinations of the raw sensors.
segment.target: Fusion sensors get their data from combinations of the raw sensors.

segment.source: The Windows Runtime APIs can access all of these sensors except for the magnetometer.
segment.target: The Windows Runtime APIs can access all of these sensors except for the magnetometer.

segment.source: Fusion sensors are more accurate and stable than raw sensors, but they use more power.
segment.target: Fusion sensors are more accurate and stable than raw sensors, but they use more power.

segment.source: You should use the right sensors for the right purpose.
segment.target: You should use the right sensors for the right purpose.

segment.source: For more info, see Sensors.
segment.target: For more info, see Sensors.

segment.source: Connected standby: When the PC is in connected standby state, Geolocator objects can always be instantiated.
segment.target: Connected standby: When the PC is in connected standby state, Geolocator objects can always be instantiated.

segment.source: However, the Geolocator object will not find any sensors to aggregate and therefore calls to GetGeopositionAsync will time out after 7 seconds, PositionChanged event listeners will never be called, and StatusChanged event listeners will be called once with the NoData status.
segment.target: However, the Geolocator object will not find any sensors to aggregate and therefore calls to GetGeopositionAsync will time out after 7 seconds, PositionChanged event listeners will never be called, and StatusChanged event listeners will be called once with the NoData status.

segment.source: Detecting changes in location settings
segment.target: Detecting changes in location settings

segment.source: The user can turn off location functionality by using the location privacy settings in the Settings app.
segment.target: The user can turn off location functionality by using the location privacy settings in the Settings app.

segment.source: To detect when the user disables or reenables location services:
segment.target: To detect when the user disables or reenables location services:

segment.source: Handle the StatusChanged event.
segment.target: Handle the StatusChanged event.

segment.source: The Status property of the argument to the StatusChanged event has the value Disabled if the user turns off location services.
segment.target: The Status property of the argument to the StatusChanged event has the value Disabled if the user turns off location services.

segment.source: Check the error codes returned from GetGeopositionAsync.
segment.target: Check the error codes returned from GetGeopositionAsync.

segment.source: If the user has disabled location services, calls to GetGeopositionAsync fail with an ACCESS\_DENIED error and the LocationStatus property has the value Disabled.
segment.target: If the user has disabled location services, calls to GetGeopositionAsync fail with an ACCESS\_DENIED error and the LocationStatus property has the value Disabled.

segment.source: If you have an app for which location data is essential—for example, a mapping app—, be sure to do the following:
segment.target: If you have an app for which location data is essential—for example, a mapping app—, be sure to do the following:

segment.source: Handle the PositionChanged event to get updates if the user’s location changes.
segment.target: Handle the PositionChanged event to get updates if the user’s location changes.

segment.source: Handle the StatusChanged event as described previously, to detect changes in location settings.
segment.target: Handle the StatusChanged event as described previously, to detect changes in location settings.

segment.source: Note that the location service will return data as it becomes available.
segment.target: Note that the location service will return data as it becomes available.

segment.source: It may first return a location with a larger error radius and then update the location with more accurate information as it becomes available.
segment.target: It may first return a location with a larger error radius and then update the location with more accurate information as it becomes available.

segment.source: Apps displaying the user's location would normally want to update the location as more accurate information becomes available.
segment.target: Apps displaying the user's location would normally want to update the location as more accurate information becomes available.

segment.source: Graphical representations of location
segment.target: Graphical representations of location

segment.source: Have your app use Geocoordinate.accuracy to denote the user’s current location on the map clearly.
segment.target: Have your app use Geocoordinate.accuracy to denote the user’s current location on the map clearly.

segment.source: There are three main bands for accuracy—an error radius of approximately 10 meters, an error radius of approximately 100 meters, and an error radius of greater than 1 kilometer.
segment.target: There are three main bands for accuracy—an error radius of approximately 10 meters, an error radius of approximately 100 meters, and an error radius of greater than 1 kilometer.

segment.source: By using the accuracy information, you can ensure that your app displays location accurately in the context of the data available.
segment.target: By using the accuracy information, you can ensure that your app displays location accurately in the context of the data available.

segment.source: For general information about using the map control, see Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views.
segment.target: For general information about using the map control, see Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views.

segment.source: For accuracy approximately equal to 10 meters (GPS resolution), location can be denoted by a dot or pin on the map.
segment.target: For accuracy approximately equal to 10 meters (GPS resolution), location can be denoted by a dot or pin on the map.

segment.source: With this accuracy, latitude-longitude coordinates and street address can be shown as well.
segment.target: With this accuracy, latitude-longitude coordinates and street address can be shown as well.

segment.source: example of map displayed at gps accuracy of approximately 10 meters.
segment.target: example of map displayed at gps accuracy of approximately 10 meters.

segment.source: For accuracy between 10 and 500 meters (approximately 100 meters), location is generally received through Wi-Fi resolution.
segment.target: For accuracy between 10 and 500 meters (approximately 100 meters), location is generally received through Wi-Fi resolution.

segment.source: Location obtained from cellular has an accuracy of around 300 meters.
segment.target: Location obtained from cellular has an accuracy of around 300 meters.

segment.source: In such a case, we recommend that your app show an error radius.
segment.target: In such a case, we recommend that your app show an error radius.

segment.source: For apps that show directions where a centering dot is required, such a dot can be shown with an error radius surrounding it.
segment.target: For apps that show directions where a centering dot is required, such a dot can be shown with an error radius surrounding it.

segment.source: example of map displayed at wi-fi accuracy of approximately 100 meters.
segment.target: example of map displayed at wi-fi accuracy of approximately 100 meters.

segment.source: If the accuracy returned is greater than 1 kilometer, you are probably receiving location info at IP-level resolution.
segment.target: If the accuracy returned is greater than 1 kilometer, you are probably receiving location info at IP-level resolution.

segment.source: This level of accuracy is often too low to pinpoint a particular spot on a map.
segment.target: This level of accuracy is often too low to pinpoint a particular spot on a map.

segment.source: Your app should zoom in to the city level on the map, or to the appropriate area based on the error radius (for example, region level).
segment.target: Your app should zoom in to the city level on the map, or to the appropriate area based on the error radius (for example, region level).

segment.source: example of map displayed at wi-fi accuracy of approximately 1 kilometer.
segment.target: example of map displayed at wi-fi accuracy of approximately 1 kilometer.

segment.source: When location accuracy switches from one band of accuracy to another, provide a graceful transition between the different graphical representations.
segment.target: When location accuracy switches from one band of accuracy to another, provide a graceful transition between the different graphical representations.

segment.source: This can be done by:
segment.target: This can be done by:

segment.source: Making the transition animation smooth and keeping the transition fast and fluid.
segment.target: Making the transition animation smooth and keeping the transition fast and fluid.

segment.source: Waiting for a few consecutive reports to confirm the change in accuracy, to help prevent unwanted and too-frequent zooms.
segment.target: Waiting for a few consecutive reports to confirm the change in accuracy, to help prevent unwanted and too-frequent zooms.

segment.source: Textual representations of location
segment.target: Textual representations of location

segment.source: Some types of apps—for example, a weather app or a local information app—need ways to represent location textually at the different bands of accuracy.
segment.target: Some types of apps—for example, a weather app or a local information app—need ways to represent location textually at the different bands of accuracy.

segment.source: Be sure to display the location clearly and only down to the level of accuracy provided in the data.
segment.target: Be sure to display the location clearly and only down to the level of accuracy provided in the data.

segment.source: For accuracy approximately equal to 10 meters (GPS resolution), the location data received is fairly accurate and so can be communicated to the level of the neighborhood name.
segment.target: For accuracy approximately equal to 10 meters (GPS resolution), the location data received is fairly accurate and so can be communicated to the level of the neighborhood name.

segment.source: City name, state or province name, and country/region name can also be used.
segment.target: City name, state or province name, and country/region name can also be used.

segment.source: For accuracy approximately equal to 100 meters (Wi-Fi resolution), the location data received is moderately accurate and so we recommend that you display information down to the city name.
segment.target: For accuracy approximately equal to 100 meters (Wi-Fi resolution), the location data received is moderately accurate and so we recommend that you display information down to the city name.

segment.source: Avoid using the neighborhood name.
segment.target: Avoid using the neighborhood name.

segment.source: For accuracy greater than 1 kilometer (IP resolution), display only the state or province, or country/region name.
segment.target: For accuracy greater than 1 kilometer (IP resolution), display only the state or province, or country/region name.
